document.masterDocTitle: The identity of the oriental leafhopper genera Cyrta Melichar and Placidus Distant (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Stegelytrinae), with description of a new genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The identity of the oriental leafhopper genera Cyrta Melichar and Placidus Distant (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Stegelytrinae), with description of a new genus

3 . Aedeagus with a long lateral process basally
................................................. C
. flosifronta (Zhang & Wei)

4 . Frontoclypeus with a somewhat funnel-shaped yellow longitudinal patch medially; style twisted, basal part laterally curved in dorsal view (see

and
5 in

)....
C . incurvata (Wei & Zhang)

E in Zhang & Wei 2002 ) ......................................................................................
C. striolata (Zhang & Wei)

- Aedeagus not as above; valve fused to subgenital plate (
Fig. 9
F)............................................................... 6

G) .............................................................................................................................
C. coalita
sp. n.

- Inner process of male pygofer weakly curved dorsally, apex not exceeding dorsal margin of pygofer side (

G) .....................................................................................................................
C. fujianensis
sp. n.

8 . Aedeagus very broad basally with several stout spines laterally on shaft (
Figs 7

C. spinosa
sp. n.

Figs 6–7
in

) .............
C. furcata (Li & Zhang)

11 . Aedeagal shaft strongly tapered from base to apex in lateral view (
Fig. 6

C. tiantaishanensis
sp. n.

- Aedeagal shaft weakly tapered from base to apex in lateral view (

C) .................

C. orientalis (Schumacher)

18 . Body generally blackish brown; aedeagal shaft with lateral margins nearly parallel in ventral view (see
Figs 1
A, B and F in Zhang & Wei 2002 ).......................................................................
C. hornei (Distant)

- Body generally light brown; aedeagul shaft distinctly broadened medially in ventral view (see Fig. 58 b in
Kuoh 1992
)
..................................................................................................................... C. testacea
(Kuoh)
